text:
Eric Schmidt is effectively describing a fork in the global AI system that will define the next decade.

The U.S. is building closed frontier stacks while China is seeding the world with free LLMs that every startup can absorb.

China‚Äôs strategy makes sense to me because it has the lowest-cost energy base for AI so open-sourcing its models accelerates ecosystem adoption at global scale.

But even if China releases millions of small open models, the highest-value workloads still end up running on $NVDA hardware, inside $AMZN, $MSFT & $GOOGL clouds & on enterprise platforms like $PLTR, $SNOW & $NOW.

China‚Äôs open-source push widens the funnel but the top of the value chain stays the same.

$GOOGL deserves to be valued like a ~$4T company because it is the only player that controls every layer of the AI stack & compounds them inside one ecosystem. 

AI Silicon
‚Ä¢ Google builds & trains on its own silicon which means TPUs remove the $NVDA markup that every other player pays & create a structurally lower cost of compute. The fact that $META & Anthropic are already in active discussions to purchase billions of dollars of TPU capacity confirms that Google‚Äôs hardware strategy is working at scale.

AI Data Engine
‚Ä¢ Google also trains on the richest real-time data corpus in the world. Search, YouTube, Maps, Gmail, Chrome & Android feed a continuous stream of user behavior that improves the model every time people migrate toward AI-driven usage. 

AI Brain 
‚Ä¢ The company now operates a frontier-level model with Gemini 3 which is trained entirely on its own chips & integrated across every major product surface. AI is strengthening Search, accelerating Cloud & expanding the monetization potential of YouTube. Instead of creating risk like many said it would, AI is actually widening the runway for every core segment.

AI Network
‚Ä¢ Google‚Äôs distribution advantage might be the most important layer. The company can deploy new AI capabilities to billions of people instantly through Search, YouTube, Android & Workspace. A single update alters the behavior of the entire internet because these platforms already dominate global mobile, browser & video time.

Google won.

Warren Buffett‚Äôs basically saying investing is rigged in your favor if you have patience.

You can sit there & watch pitch after pitch go by & refuse to care that everyone around you is swinging at everything out of FOMO since the market only punishes the swings you take, not the ones you skip.

That‚Äôs an insane advantage if you actually have the patience to use it.

$SPY is less than 1% off ATH but most of the Fintwit names still need real price construction before they can reclaim trend. 

$NVDA, $AMD, $EOSE, $OPEN, $TSLA, $PLTR, $IREN, $CIFR, $NBIS, $ONDS, $OKLO, $RKLB, $ASTS, $IONQ, $HOOD, $SOFI, $TEM, $ACHR, $OSCR, $HIMS

A bullish setup for me is when two of the three signals line up: short-term momentum (8 over 21), support at the 50-day or strength above the 200-day. 

If two hold then momentum & structure are usually moving in the same direction.

The fact that $NVDA is on pace to generate ~$400B of cash in two years (more than $AMD entire market cap) is wild.

It's happening because Nvidia owns the most profitable part of the AI stack and physical AI in autonomy & robotics hasn‚Äôt even begun to contribute yet. 

Bullish.

4 Steps to Improve Your P&L

Step 1: Crunch Those Numbers

Put all your trade data into a spreadsheet. 

Step 2: Spot the Leaks

Look for the common threads. Are you selling winners too soon? Violating your daily loss limit? 

Step 3: Break One Account-Draining Habit

Pick one money-draining mistake and squash it. Cutting ‚Äúunforced errors‚Äù is the fastest way to stack cash.

Step 4: Rinse, Repeat, and Win!

Every $10K in mistakes you fix adds $10K to your account. Get less bad before you try to get better!
